title: How to Make Marzipan Toadstools

steps.headline: Cut the block of marzipan with a sharp knife.
steps.description: Wrap one half in plastic food wrap and put the other half into a small bowl.

steps.headline: Add a drop of red food coloring to the bowl.
steps.description: Mix into the marzipan with your fingers. Add another drop and see how the color improves. Add more drops if needed; judge this as you go.

steps.headline: Break the newly red marzipan into 8 evenly sized pieces.
Roll a red piece of marzipan into a ball.
steps.description: Squash the ball between your thumb and forefinger to form a mushroom shape. Push your thumb right up and under the ball to create a hollow. Repeat for the remaining 7 pieces.

steps.headline: Wash your hands before handling the white marzipan.
steps.description: This will ensure that you don't transfer any red coloring to the white. Unwrap the half of the marzipan you earlier set aside. Turn this into spots: break off a third of the marzipan, then roll it into many little balls of varying sizes.

steps.headline: Press several little white marzipan balls onto each red toadstool top.
steps.description: Break the remaining piece of marzipan into 8 pieces, to create the stalks.

steps.headline: To make the stalks, roll each piece of marzipan between your fingers.
steps.description: Gently press a spotted toadstool top onto the top of each stalk.

steps.headline: Use as needed.
steps.description: The toadstools can be eaten like candy if you like marzipan, added to a cake top, used in sugar craft designs, etc.

text: Preparing the marzipan Cut the block of marzipan with a sharp knife. Wrap one half in plastic food wrap and put the other half into a small bowl. Add a drop of red food coloring to the bowl. Mix into the marzipan with your fingers. Add another drop and see how the color improves. Add more drops if needed; judge this as you go. Break the newly red marzipan into 8 evenly sized pieces.  Making the toadstools Roll a red piece of marzipan into a ball. Squash the ball between your thumb and forefinger to form a mushroom shape. Push your thumb right up and under the ball to create a hollow. Repeat for the remaining 7 pieces. Wash your hands before handling the white marzipan. This will ensure that you don't transfer any red coloring to the white. Unwrap the half of the marzipan you earlier set aside. Turn this into spots: break off a third of the marzipan, then roll it into many little balls of varying sizes. Press several little white marzipan balls onto each red toadstool top. Break the remaining piece of marzipan into 8 pieces, to create the stalks. To make the stalks, roll each piece of marzipan between your fingers. Gently press a spotted toadstool top onto the top of each stalk. Use as needed. The toadstools can be eaten like candy if you like marzipan, added to a cake top, used in sugar craft designs, etc.
